member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.AddAudioTrackBlocks
member.summary: Adds blocks of audio data to the currently open track. This method can be called repeatedly until there is no space available or the track is full.
member.param: Pointer to an array of track blocks. The format is 44.1 KHz 16-bit stereo RAW audio samples, in the same format as used by WAV in the data section.
Size of the array, in bytes. This count must be a multiple of the audio block size.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.CloseAudioTrack
member.summary: Closes a currently open audio track. All audio tracks must be closed before the method can be called.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.CreateAudioTrack
member.summary: Begins staging a new audio track. It can be called only when there are no open audio tracks in the image.

param.name: nBlocks
param.para: Number of audio blocks to be added to this track. You can create up to 99 tracks, and the open track may consume all remaining available audio blocks.
The nBlocks parameter is advisory only. It does not force the track length to this size.

member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.GetAudioBlockSize
member.summary: Retrieves the size, in bytes, of an audio block.
member.param: Total size, in bytes, of a single audio block.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.GetAvailableAudioTrackBlocks
member.summary: Retrieves the current number of blocks that can be added to the track before an additional add will cause a failure for lack of space.
member.param: Number of audio blocks that can be added to the open track before it must be closed.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.GetTotalAudioBlocks
member.summary: Retrieves the total number of blocks available for staging audio tracks. The total includes all block types, including blocks that may need to be allocated for track gaps.
member.param: Total number of audio blocks available on a disc.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.GetTotalAudioTracks
member.summary: Retrieves the total number of tracks that have either been staged or are being staged.
member.param: Total number of closed and open tracks.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IRedbookDiscMaster.GetUsedAudioBlocks
member.summary: Retrieves the total number of audio blocks in use.
member.param: Total number of blocks in use, in both closed and open tracks.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: TheIRedbookDiscMaster interface enables the staging of an audio CD image. It represents one of the formats supported by MSDiscMasterObj, and it allows the creation of multi-track audio discs in Track-at-Once mode (fixed-size audio gaps).

Tracks are created in the stash file, data is added to them, and then they are closed. Only one track is staged at a time; this is called the open track. The remaining tracks are closed and committed to the image, while the open track has available to it all the blocks that are not in use by closed tracks.
